revisionhistoryelem.comment: 2010-05-25, SGSN-MME 2010B. ffv/fiv values aligned with ebm.xml.
2010-12-22, SGSN-MME 2011A. Cause codes for new featues added. .Also review of S1 cause codes and added undocumented legacy SGSN (sub) causes codes.
2011-01-20, SGSN-MME 2011A update. SCC 438 fixed plus bearer sub causes moved to own enum BEARER_CAUSE.
2011-04-19, SGSN-MME 2011A FP01. Legacy descriptions improved and new features for S4-SGSN mainly.
2011-05-16, SGSN-MME 2011B. Legacy descriptions improved and new features for S4-SGSN mainly.

parametertype.name: GTP_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with an invalid format.
This cause code indicates that MS does not respond to the request from the network
This cause code indicates that MS refuses the request due to a BCM violation or error unspecified in RIL3.

This cause code is used by the MS or network to indicate that a PDP context activation request, secondary PDP context activation request, PDP context modification request, or MBMS context activation request cannot be accepted due to insufficient resources.
This cause code indicates that SGSN does not support network requested bearer control.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with incorrect mandatory IE.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with missing mandatory IE.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with incorrect optional IE.
"System failure" is a generic permanent error condition reported in the reject response message.
This cause code indicates that the linked PDPcontext does not exist or was deactivated in the receiving SGSN.
This cause code indicates that a request is violating the current Bearer Control Mode.

parametertype.name: GTPV2_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause is sent when the request is accepted.
This cause is sent when the request is partially accepted.
This cause is sent when the request is rejected.
This cause is sent when the UE does not respond.
This cause is sent when the context is not found.
This cause is sent when the message format is invalid.
This cause is sent when the length of the message is invalid.
This cause is sent when the mandatory IE is incorrect.
This cause is sent when the mandatory IE is missing.
A rejection response cause code value with the meaning "Reserved".
This cause code is used by the system to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to an error situation in the system.
This cause is sent when there are no resources available.
This cause is sent when the IE is unexpectedly repeated.
This cause is sent when the UE does not respond.
This cause is sent when the UE is in suspended status.
This cause is in a Create Bearer Response, if the feature 'Dedicated bearer' is off in LTE or the feature 'Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context' is off in WCDMA.
This cause code is included in the #EBM# event L_Handover generated when an S1-Based Inter-#MME# Handover fails.
This cause code is sent when the sending node considers the other peer to be invalid for the specific procedure.
This cause code is sent by the #SGW# when it considers a reply from #PGW# to be invalid.
This cause code is sent when an #SGW#-initiated procedure is rejected due to a Handover being in progress.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE missing.
This cause code indicates that the UE refuses the request.

parametertype.name: NAS_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause is sent to the UE when it is not allowed to operate either EPS or non-EPS services. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause is sent to the #UE# which requests #EPS# service in a #PLMN# where the #UE#, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"
This cause is sent to the UE when there is a failure in the EPS session management message contained in the EPS mobility management message.
This cause is sent to the #UE# because of congestion in the network (that is for example no channel, facility busy or congested).
This cause is sent to the network in S1 mode if the separation bit in the AMF field of Authentication Token (AUTN) is set to 0 in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external PDN, due to that the APN was not included although required or if the APN could not be resolved.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external PDN due to a failed user authentication.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service or operation or the request for a resource was rejected by the #SGW# or #PGW#.
This cause is used by the network when the UE requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.
This cause is sent when the UE requests a service option for which it has no subscription.

This cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to an error situation in the network. It may be sent when in case of PGW initiated Delete Bearer Request with cause "Reactivation requested", for the not last PDN connection, if it is configured in Deactivate EPS Bearer Context Request to UE, this cause code is included
This cause is used by the network to indicate that only PDN type IPv4 is allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that only PDN type IPv6 is allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.
This cause is used by the network or UE to indicate that the PTI provided to it is unassigned or reserved.
This cause is sent to the #UE# if the network cannot service a #UE# generated request because of network failures.

This cause is sent to the UE when the network cannot derive the identity of the UE from the GUTI, S-TMSI, or P-TMSI and RAI. This can occur when there is no matching identity or context in the network or if there is a failure to validate the identity of the UE due to integrity check failure of the received message.

This cause code is sent to the UE if the network has implicitly detached the UE, some time after the mobile reachable timer has expired, or if the EMM context data related to the subscription does not exist in the MME due to an MME restart.
Cause code 0 is used at success/ignore/abort events and indicates that no cause code are sent externally from the SGSN-MME.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the PTI included by the UE is already in use by another active UE-requested procedure for this UE.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the PDN Connectivity procedure was rejected due to that multiple PDN connections for a given APN are not allowed.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service, operation or the request for a resource was rejected due to unspecified reasons.
This cause is used by the network at handover from a non-3GPP access network to indicate that the MME does not have any information about the requested PDN connection.
This cause is used to report receipt of a message with semantically incorrect contents.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a non-semantical mandatory IE error.

This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a message type it does not recognize either because this is a message not defined, or defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this cause.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message not compatible with the protocol state.

This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements not recognized. This can be because the IE identifier is not defined or it is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause. However, the information element is not required to be present in the message in order for the equipment sending the cause to process the message.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE errors.
This cause indicates that a message has been received which is incompatible with the protocol state.
This cause is used to report a protocol error event only when no other cause in the protocol error class applies.

This cause is used by the network or the UE to indicate that the EPS bearer identity value provided to it is not a valid value for the received message or the EPS bearer context identified by the linked EPS bearer identity IE in the request is not active.
This cause is used by the network to indicate that the UE requested PDN disconnection procedure on the last remaining PDN connection is not allowed.
This ESM cause is sent by the network to inform the UE that that the cause of the Attach Reject is that an ESM Information Response is missing.

This cause is sent to the #UE# if it requests access in a #PLMN# where the #UE#, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause code is sent to the #UE# when there is no #EPS# subscription in the #HSS# for this #IMSI# or when the #RAT# is not allowed for the #IMSI# according to subscription data in #HSS#. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause is sent to the #UE# if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the #UE#, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause is sent to the #UE# if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the #UE#, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"
This EMM cause is sent to the #UE# if the #MME# cannot service a #UE# generated request because of no availability of #CS# domain.
This cause is sent to the #UE# if it requests a combined EPS/IMSI attach or a combined TA/LA update and the #MSC# is temporarily not reachable from the #MME# over the SGs interface.

This cause code is sent to the #UE# if it requests access in a network where the #IMSI# of the #UE# is unknown in the #HSS#. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause code is sent to the #UE#, in the Attach or #TAU# Accept message, if received from the #MSC/VLR# in a Location Update procedure. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

This cause code is sent to the #UE# if it requests access to a network where the #ME# is considered illegal. It is also sent if the #UE# has not included #IMEISV# in the Security Mode Complete message. it is also sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"
This cause is sent if the UE detects that the UE security capabilities does not match the one sent back by the network.

This cause is sent to the #UE# if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the #UE#, due to Roaming Restrictions, is not allowed to operate. Self-activation device support enables users to subscribe and activate services by themselves using pre-distributed and not-fully provisioned UICC and eHRPD/LTE network. This cause code may be configured and sent to UE in Detach Request message in case that HSS initiated Cancel Location request with cancel type "Subscription withdrawal" or PGW initiated Delete Bearer Request to remove the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".
This cause is sent to the MS if the network does not accept emergency call establishment using an IMEI or not accept attach procedure for emergency services using an IMEI.
The USIM detects that the Media Access Control (MAC) in the Authentication Request message is not fresh.
The USIM detects that the Sequence Number (SQN) in the Authentication Request message is out of range.
The Security Mode command is rejected by the UE.
The SGW responds with unknown PDN address or PDN type.

Indicates a regular UE- or network-initiated release of EPS bearer resources. It may be sent when in case of PGW initiated Delete Bearer Request with cause "Reactivation requested", for the not last PDN connection, if it is configured in Deactivate EPS Bearer Context Request to UE, this cause code is included
The requested service was rejected due to a semantic error in the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) operation included in the request.
The requested service was rejected due to a syntactical error in the TFT operation included in the request.
The requested service was rejected due to one or more syntactical errors in packet filters of the TFT included in the request.
The requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only single IP version bearers are allowed.
PGW initiated Delete Bearer Request with cause "Reactivation requested", not last PDN connection, in Deactivate EPS Bearer Context Request from MME to UE, this cause code is included

it may be sent in Detach Request message if it is configured in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscrition withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

parametertype.name: RIL3_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause is sent to the MS if the ME used is not acceptable to the network, e.g. blacklisted. When used by an MM procedure, this cause does not affect operation of the GPRS service.
This cause is sent to an MS which requests location updating in a location area of a PLMN which by subscription offers roaming to that MS but not in that Location Area.

This cause is sent to the MS MS if it requests location updating in a location area where the PLMN determines that the MS, by subscription, is not allowed to operate. The MS is not triggered to search for another allowed location area on the same PLMN.
This cause is sent to the MS if it requests location updating in a PLMN where the MS, by subscription or due to operator determined barring is not allowed to operate.

This cause is sent to the MS in the following situations: *The MS requests location updating in a location area where the MS, by subscription, is not allowed to operate and should instead find another allowed location area in the same PLMN.;*The SGSN is configured with Roaming Restrictions.;
This cause is sent to the MS if it requests a combined GPRS attach or RAU in a PLMN where the MSC is temporarily not reachable via the GPRS part of the network.

This cause is sent to the MS in the following situations: *The MSC cannot service an MS-generated request because of PLMN failures, for example, problems in MAP or Diameter.;*The HLR/HSS does not respond to the SGSN messages or the SGSN cannot send messages to the HLR/HSS.;*The HLR/HSS sends an empty response to the SGSN during the authentication.;
This cause is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the MAC in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST or AUTHENTICATION_AND_CIPHERING REQUEST message is not fresh (see 3GPP TS 33.102 [5a]).

"This cause is sent if the service request cannot be auctioned because of congestion (e.g. No channel, facility busy/congested etc). Note: When the CS part has failed but the GPRS part is OK (reject from MSC), accept is sent to the MS with CC to indicate that the CS-attach has failed."

This cause is sent to the network in Iu mode if a USIM is inserted in the MS and there is no Authentication Parameter AUTN IE present in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST or AUTHENTICATION_AND_CIPHERING REQUEST message.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a non-semantical mandatory IE error.
This cause is used to report a protocol error event only when no other cause in the protocol error class applies.
This cause is sent to the MS when it is not allowed to operate GPRS services.
This cause is sent to the MS when it is not allowed to operate either GPRS or non-GPRS services.
This cause is sent to the MS when the network cannot derive the MS's identity from the P-TMSI in case of inter-SGSN routing area update

This cause is sent to the MS either if the network has implicitly detached the MS, e.g. some while after the Mobile reachable timer has expired, or if the GMM context data related to the subscription dose not exist in the SGSN e.g. because of a SGSN restart.
This cause is sent to the MS which requests GPRS service in a PLMN which does not offer roaming for GPRS services to that MS

This cause code is used by the MS or by the network to indicate that a PDP context activation request, secondary PDP context activation request, PDP context modification request, or MBMS context activation request cannot be accepted due to insufficient resources.

This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service is rejected by the external packet data network if the APN is not included although required, or if the APN cannot be resolved.

This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network because the access point name was not included although required or if the access point name could not be resolved.
This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network due to a failed user authentication.
This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the GGSN, Serving GW or PDN GW.
This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to unspecified reasons.
This cause code is used by the network when the MS requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.
This cause is sent when the MS requests a service option for which it has no subscription.
This cause code is used to indicate a regular MS or network initiated PDP context deactivation or a regular network initiated MBMS context deactivation.
This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the PDP context deactivation or the MBMS context deactivation is caused by an error situation in the network.
This cause code is used by SGSN to indicate that a context reactivation is needed
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code does not support the requested feature.

This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is a semantic error in the TFT operation included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.

This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is a syntactical error int he TFT operation included i n a secondary Pep context activation request or an MS-initiated Pep context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.

This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that the PDP context identified by the Linked TI IE in the secondary PDP context activation request or a network requested secondary PDP context activation is not active.

This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is one or more semantic errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.

This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is one or more syntactical errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.
This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that it has already activated a PDP context without TFT.
This cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is BCM violation between MS and the network.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a transaction identifier which is not currently in use on the MS-network interface.
This cause is used to report receipt of a message with semantically incorrect contents.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message with message type non-existent or not implemented.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message with type not compatible with the protocol state.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message with information element non-existent or not implemented.
This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE errors.
This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message not compatible with the protocol state.

Cause code 0 is used at success/ignore/abort events and indicates that no cause code are sent externally from the SGSN-MME. Reject events never use Cause code 0 except for events that represents procedures where SM Status messages have been sent.
This cause is sent to the MS if the MS is not known (registered) in the HLR. This cause code does not affect operation of the GPRS service, although is may be used by a GMM procedure.
This cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only PDP type IPv4 is allowed.
This cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only PDP type IPv6 is allowed.
This cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only single IP version bearers are allowed.
This cause exists in Activate PDP Context Reject, if S4-SGSN receives Create Session Response with cause #104 APN Restriction type Incompatible with currently active PDN connection.

This cause is sent to the MS when the network refuses service to the MS either because an identity of the MS is not acceptable to the network or because the MS does not pass the authentication check, i.e. the SRES received from the MS is different from that generated by the network. When used by an MM procedure, except the authentication procedure, this cause does not affect operation of the GPRS service.
This cause is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the SQN in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST or AUTHENTICATION_AND_CIPHERING REQUEST message is out of range (see 3GPP TS 33.102 [5a]).

This cause code is used by the MS indicate that a PDP context is deactivated because of a LLC or SNDCP failure (e.g. if the SM receives a SNSM-STATUS.request message with cause "DM received " or " invalid XID response ", see 3GPP TS 44.065 [78])
This cause is sent when the MSC cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service.
This cause code is used by the MS if the new QoS cannot be accepted that were indicated by the network in the PDP Context Modification procedure.

parametertype.name: RIL3_CAUSE2_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause is sent to the MS if the MS requests an establishment of the radio access bearers for all active PDP contexts by sending a SERVICE REQUEST message indicating "data" to the network, but the SGSN does not have any active PDP context(s).

parametertype.name: S1AP_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" value should be analyzed.

enumeration.enum: This cause is sent when the MME detects a handover related failure in the target SGW, PGW, eNodeB, or system.
Unspecified
The successful-handover cause code is a Radio Network Layer cause for the S1AP protocol.
This cause is sent when the PDN connection is released due to LTE generated reasons.
This cause is sent when the #MME# detects a Handover related failure in the target #SGW#, #PGW#, eNodeB, or system.
The ho-target-not-allowed cause code is a Radio Network Layer cause for the S1AP protocol indicating that the target cell is not allowed for the UE in question.

In case of intra MME S1-based handover, this cause code is sent when the target eNodeB is unknown to the MME. In case of inter MME S1-based Handover, this cause code is sent when the source MME cannot find the target MME.
This cause is sent when the S1AP identity is unknown in the UE or MME.
This cause is sent when the S1AP identity is unknown in the UE or eNodeB.

The unknown-pair-ue-s1ap-id cause code is a Radio Network Layer cause for the S1AP protocol that is sent when the action failed because both UE S1AP IDs are unknown, or are known but do not define a single UE context.
This cause is sent when the radio connection with the UE is lost.
The cause occurs due to a CS fallback that has been triggered.
This cause us sent when there are no radio resources available.
This cause is sent when there is a failure in the radio interface procedure.
This cause is sent when the QoS combination is not valid.
This cause is sent when there is interaction between different procedures.
This cause is sent when the RAB identity is unknown.
This cause is sent when there are multiple RAB identity instances.
This cause is sent when there is no transport resource available.
This cause is sent when unspecified transport layer problems occur.
This cause is sent when the message is not compatible with the state of the receiver.
This cause is sent when there is a semantic error.
This cause is sent due to an unspecified protocol error.
The control-processing-overload cause code is a Miscellaneous cause for the S1AP protocol.
The cause is sent when there are not enough processing resources on the user plane .
This cause is sent when there is a hardware failure.
The om-intervention cause code is a Miscellaneous cause for the S1AP protocol where the action is due to Operation and Maintenance intervention.
This cause is sent when there is a unspecified failure.
No response received from eNodeB
The release is requested due to redirection towards a 1xRTT system.
The MME has received a Handover Cancel message and terminated the ongoing Handover preparation procedure.

parametertype.name: SUB_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Detailed reason for failure" information. This information should be analyzed together with the "Cause Code" parameter and the "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" parameter. Some sub cause codes are also used as BEARER_CAUSE.

enumeration.enum: No SubCauseCode available
Auth failed
Auth failed: unknown subscriber PLMN not allowed
Auth failed: unknown subscriber, operator determined barring
Auth failed: unknown subscriber, IMSI unknown
Auth failed: unknown subscriber
Auth failed: roaming not allowed GPRS subscription unknown
Auth failed: roaming not allowed
Auth failed: roaming not allowed, operator determined barring
Auth failed: roaming not allowed, PLMN not allowed
Auth failed: roaming not allowed, IMSI unknown
Auth failed: roaming restriction in SGSN unsupported feature
Auth failed: no relevant GPRS subscription in this SGSN
Auth failed: bad GMM cause or other RIL3 reason
Auth failed: ciphering algorithm mismatch
Auth failed: undefined IMSI series
Auth failed: undefined IMSI
Auth failed: establish ciphered connection failed
Auth failed: system failure
Auth failed: unexpected data value
Auth failed: map error
Auth failed: aborted
Auth failed: SRES mismatch
Auth failed: MAC failure
Auth failed: synch failure
Auth failed: access restricted
Auth failed: no answer to authentication and ciphering request
Auth failed: unknown subscriber, GPRS subscription unknown
Auth failed: unexpected response from ms
Auth failed: UMTS GSM res mismatch
Error Indication from GGSN/SGW received
Removal of Subscription data in HLR
GTP timeout towards GGSN during SGSN initiated modification
GGSN responded with reject cause different from #192 during SGSN initiated modification
Create BSS PFC Nack with cause different from #00,#06 and #0A received
GTP timeout towards GGSN during BSS initiated modification
GGSN responded with reject cause different from #192 during BSS initiated modification
RNC did not return a valid response when type is modify
Higher QoS from GGSN during MS modification procedure admission control
Higher QoS from GGSN during ISRAU or SGSN/BSS modification procedure license missing
Higher QoS from GGSN during ISRAU or SGSN/BSS modification procedure admission control
QoS changed by GGSN during MS modification procedure
QoS changed by GGSN during SGSN modification procedure
GGSN responded with reject cause #192 during SGSN initiated modification
No response from MS during SGSN initiated modification
GGSN responded with reject cause #192 during BSS initiated modification
No response from MS during BSS initiated modification
XID Negotiation
Modification of VPLMN address allowed in HLR
RAB re-establishment failure
PDP deactivated during mobility procedure
Upd loc failed
Upd loc failed: roaming not allowed, GPRS subscriber unknown
Upd loc failed: roaming not allowed, IMSI unknown
Upd loc failed: roaming not allowed, operator determined barring
Upd loc failed: roaming not allowed, PLMN not allowed
Upd loc failed: roaming not allowed
Upd loc failed: roaming restriction SGSN unsupported feature
Upd loc failed: undefined IMSI series
Upd loc failed: undefined IMSI
Upd loc failed: no relevant GPRS subscription in this SGSN
Upd loc failed: unknown subscriber PLMN not allowed
Upd loc failed: unknown subscriber operator determined barring
Upd loc failed: unknown subscriber
Upd loc failed: unknown subscriber GPRS subscription unknown
Upd loc failed: unknown subscriber IMSI unknown
Upd loc failed: system failure
Upd loc failed: unexpected data value
Upd loc failed: map error
Upd loc failed: aborted
Upd loc failed: access restricted
No response from MS during GGSN/PGW initiated modification
RNC rejected RAB re-establishment with a non QoS related cause
Higher QoS from GGSN during MS modification procedure license missing
QoS from GGSN without Traffic Class support
Interference of activation: deactivation
Interference of activation: already activated context
Interference of activation: detach
Interference of activation: mobility procedure
Reject from SGSN, GTP message failed
Reject from SGSN, no response from MS
Reject from SGSN, BCM violation
Reject from SGSN, SGSN does not support network requested bearer control
Reject from SGSN, linked pdp context not exist or deactivated
Reject from MS
Ril3 message failed, reject from MS
GTP97 not supported
GTP: timeout
GTP: Mandatory IE incorrect
GTP: Mandatory IE missing
GTP: Optional IE incorrect
GTP: Invalid message format
GTP: sending of message towards SGSN failed
Insert IMSI failed, undefined IMSI series
Insert IMSI failed, other reason
Insert IMSI failed, multiple IMSIs
IMSI failure - multiple CIDs using one IMSI
SGSN context response, PTMSI sign mismatch
SGSN context response, IMSI not known
SGSN context response, system failure
SGSN context response, other reason
Other GTP cause code
RIL3 message failed
RIL3 message failed: authentication request
RIL3 message failed: authentication response
RIL3 message failed: identity request
RIL3 message failed: identity response
RIL3 message failed: attach request
QoS changed

This cause code is used at the success event and indicates that bearers are deleted on the source SGSN during the IRAT PS handover procedure.
This cause code is used by the source SGSN to indicate that the bearers, which are not set-up on the target SGSN-MME, are deleted on the source SGSN during the IRAT PS handover procedure.

The MME receives the Cancel Location Request message from the HSS with Cancel Type "Subscription Withdrawal".
The MME receives the Delete Bearer Request message for the last PDN connection with GTPv2 cause code "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".
The MME receives the Delete Bearer Request message not for the last PDN connection with GTPv2 cause code "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".
The MME receives the Delete Bearer Request message not for the last PDN connection with GTPv2 cause code "Reactivation requested".

Change of Subscription data in the HSS.
QoS profile invalid
Reject when taking the UE to PMM-CONNECTED state.
Used in the Network Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure using S4, for CC #68, service not supported.

Used during attach or mobility procedure when the new PLMN does not support the corresponding IMS emergency service due to configuration, or when the configuration in new PLMN is not know during Inter-node mobility.
Used during the IRAT HO for emergency attached UE if the target side does not support IMS emergency service.
The MME failed to find a mapping between Tracking Area and Location Area.
Used in bearer deleted due to SRVCC procedure.

During Ms initiated primary pdp context activation procedure, SGSN will check MSISDN before send create pdp context request to GGSN. If check MSISDN failed, then SGSN will send activation reject to MS with cuase ?RIL3_INVALID_MANDATORY_INFORMATION.

In S4-SGSN, MS initiated primary pdp context activation procedure, if S4-SGSN failed to do GW selction then S4-SGSN will try to fall back to Gn. But if sysprop ?s4_fallback_to_gn_allowed is false or MS has eps subscrition data or MS already has S4 PDN, then S4-SGSN failed to fall back to Gn. S4-SGSN will send activation reject to MS with cause ?RIL3_NETWORK_FAILURE.
this SCC is also used in MME. When SRVCC HO is rejected because UE capablity/ MME don't supporte SRVCC procedure.
No response from SGW for Create Session Request
S4-SGSN/MME did not receive authentication info answer from HSS.
S4-SGSN/MME did not receive update location answer from HSS.
No sub cause needed.
this is a common reason for the interface using GTPv2 protocol. It means there is no GTPv2 response message from peer node after SGSN-MME sends out a GTPv2 request message.
The authentication information answer from HSS/HLR did not contain any vectors.
Timeout while waiting for authentication response.
Non EPS authentication unacceptable.
AUTS missing in the Authentication Failure message from UE.
XRES was not equal to RES.
The subcause goes together with cause "service option not supported" and cause "PDP type IPv4 only allowed.
This sub-cause code indicates that the dedicated bearer activation is rejected because the max allowed number of bearers for the UE would be exceeded.
The request is rejected because it comes from an SGW that the MME does not regard as the current SGW.
The bearer procedure was interrupted by or could not be started due to another, higher priority procedure, e.g., Detach.
None of the dedicated bearers could be created due to failure in UE or eNodeB.
The received Linked Bearer Id indicates a non-existing bearer.
The received Linked Bearer Id indicates a dedicated bearer, not a default bearer.
IMS Emergency service is not supported for the imsi series in current TAI.
The received Linked Bearer Id in a piggybacked Create Bearer Request message does not indicate the default bearer being created.
The UE indicates an invalid default bearer id at combined activation of default bearer and dedicated bearers.

parametertype.name: BEARER_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides the possible values for the BEARER_CAUSE parameter.

enumeration.enum: Used as Bearer cause
Used as Bearer cause
